content.p: Help your child plan and manage their preparations for university, look into their options and apply. Many students look to parents and family members for guidance – as well as teachers and peers – when they're thinking about their future and making their university choices. Our top tips for parents and guardians of undergradute applicants are: Choosing a university and course is a big commitment, and we know you'll want to be sure your child makes the decision that's right for them. They may already have a clear idea of what they want to study and why, or they may be uncertain about their plans. Here are some issues you may want to discuss to help them in their decision-making journey. University open days are a great way to learn more about the university or universities your child is applying to or considering and their chosen degree course. You can talk to academics and current students, ask questions, and explore the campuses, facilities and the city where they will make themself at home. Our 2023 open days will take place on: They will include a talk for parents and carers, as well as a range of other talks, campus tours and more. Our site makes use of cookies.
